articles.author: Sarah Westwood, CNN
articles.title: White House expected to ask Congress for coronavirus funds this week
articles.description: White House officials are expected to ask Congress for emergency funding this week to battle the coronavirus amid growing fears of a larger outbreak in the US, two officials familiar with the forthcoming request said.
articles.content:
Washington (CNN)White House officials are expected to ask Congress for emergency funding this week to battle the coronavirus amid growing fears of a larger outbreak in the US, two officials familiar with the forthcoming request said.

articles.author: By James Griffiths and Jenni Marsh, CNN
articles.title: Coronavirus cases spike in South Korea and Italy
articles.content:
The Hubei health authority reported that 96 more people died of the coronavirus in China's Hubei province on Saturday, February 22, raising the death toll in the outbreak's epicenter to 2,346.

articles.title: From one-time Chinese capital to coronavirus epicenter, Wuhan has a long history that the world had forgotten

articles.author: Livia Borghese and Tara John, CNN
articles.title: Coronavirus cases soar in Italy as authorities scramble to find patient zero
articles.description: Italian authorities have announced sweeping closures in the country's north as they scramble to contain Europe's biggest outbreak of the novel coronavirus.

articles.author: Faith Karimi, CNN
articles.title: Judge blocks the transfer of coronavirus patients to a city in Southern California
articles.description: A federal judge has temporarily blocked the transfer of people infected with the coronavirus to a city in Southern California until a hearing set for this week.

articles.author: Nectar Gan, Lily Lee and David Culver, CNN
articles.title: Healthy Wuhan residents say they were forced into mass coronavirus quarantine, risking infection
articles.description: Three weeks ago, Lisa Wang was fighting a high fever when she was turned away from an overflowing hospital in Wuhan, the central Chinese city mired in a deadly coronavirus crisis.
articles.content:
They couldn't provide me with a hospital when I was sick. Now when I'm recovered, they forced me into one
Lisa Wang, a recovered patient

articles.author: James Griffiths and Jenni Marsh, CNN
articles.title: Coronavirus cases spike in South Korea and Italy, as China outbreak continues to grow

articles.author: Paul French
articles.title: From one-time Chinese capital to coronavirus epicenter, Wuhan has a long history that the world had forgotten
articles.description: From the 19th century, Wuhan regularly appeared in the international press and, as a trading hub it impacted the lives of people in the West. But after the Second World War that history was forgotten.
articles.content:
Paul French is the author of "Midnight in Peking" and "City of Devils: A Shanghai Noir," both currently being adapted for TV.
